documents.title: Rust Index Writer Module
documents.content: This code-style fixture represents a small Rust module that writes quantized vectors to disk and verifies offsets after each append. It includes a constructor, a write_record method, and an integrity check helper. The surrounding notes describe why deterministic ordering and clear error variants matter when tests compare binary output across runs.

documents.title: Python ONNX Inference Script
documents.content: This code-style fixture models a Python script that loads tokenizer assets, runs ONNX inference, and prints latency percentiles for a batch of queries. It intentionally references ONNX Runtime APIs and argument parsing patterns seen in tooling scripts. The description emphasizes reproducibility, pinned model revisions, and explicit fallback behavior when files are missing.

documents.title: Service Config with Health and Retention

It includes health check thresholds and degrade-mode toggles used by operators. The prose around the snippet explains precedence rules between environment variables, command flags, and committed defaults for reproducible behavior.

documents.content: bold&<>"

documents.title: SQL-Like Content
documents.content: DROP TABLE documents; SELECT * FROM users WHERE 1=1; INSERT INTO logs VALUES ('pwned'); DELETE FROM embeddings; UNION SELECT password FROM credentials--

documents.title: Duplicate Content A
documents.content: This document has identical content to test deduplication handling. The search system should handle documents with the same body text but different identifiers gracefully without crashing or producing incorrect results.

documents.title: Duplicate Content B
documents.content: This document has identical content to test deduplication handling. The search system should handle documents with the same body text but different identifiers gracefully without crashing or producing incorrect results.

documents.title: Excessive Whitespace
documents.content:
word1    		   word2  




   word3     word4          word5  

  word6

documents.title: Unicode and Control Character Stress
documents.content: This adversarial fixture combines multilingual text, confusable characters, and escaped control bytes in one payload to validate canonicalization safety. It is designed to ensure tokenization remains deterministic, indexing does not panic, and query matching still produces stable behavior. The content intentionally mixes normal prose with edge symbols that frequently break naive parsers.

documents.title: German: Vektorsuche und Einbettungen
documents.content: Die Vektorsuche verwendet Einbettungen, um semantisch ähnliche Dokumente zu finden. Jedes Dokument wird in einen hochdimensionalen Vektor umgewandelt. Die Kosinusnähe zwischen Vektoren misst die semantische Ähnlichkeit. Hybride Suche kombiniert lexikalische BM25-Ergebnisse mit semantischen Vektortreffen durch Reciprocal Rank Fusion.

documents.title: Structured Log Noise Burst
documents.content: This adversarial fixture simulates a noisy burst of repeated timestamped log lines with interleaved errors and partial stack traces. The text is intentionally repetitive to test scoring stability under high term frequency and low semantic value. It should remain indexable while avoiding pathological ranking behavior for normal user queries during sustained production incident replay sessions.

documents.title: Code Block Heavy Markdown Fixture
documents.content: This adversarial fixture contains markdown-like narration wrapped around dense code blocks, table syntax, and frontmatter-style headers. It exists to test canonicalizer behavior when prose is minimal and markup dominates the payload. Correct handling means preserving useful identifiers while avoiding malformed token streams and maintaining deterministic normalization output across repeated index and query runs.

documents.title: French: Recherche Sémantique
documents.content: La recherche sémantique utilise des modèles d'incorporation pour représenter le texte sous forme de vecteurs denses. La similarité cosinus entre vecteurs mesure la proximité sémantique. Les transformeurs comme BERT produisent des représentations contextuelles. La fusion par rang réciproque combine les résultats lexicaux et sémantiques.

documents.title: build.sh
documents.content:
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

echo "Building frankensearch..."
cargo fmt --all -- --check
cargo clippy --workspace --all-targets -- -D warnings
cargo test --workspace
cargo build --release --workspace

echo "Running benchmarks..."
cargo bench --workspace -- --output-format bencher

echo "Build complete. Artifacts in target/release/"

documents.title: frankensearch.toml
documents.content:
[search]
quality_weight = 0.7
rrf_k = 60.0
candidate_multiplier = 3
quality_timeout_ms = 500
fast_only = false

[embedder.fast]
model = "potion-multilingual-128M"
dimension = 256

[embedder.quality]
model = "all-MiniLM-L6-v2"
dimension = 384

[index]
quantization = "f16"
alignment = 64
mrl_search_dims = 0

[lexical]
engine = "tantivy"
k1 = 1.2
b = 0.75
